summary: Movable and static Morrowind style lanterns, converted and modified for Skyrim from Phitts Oblivion mod  Sheogorad - Forsaken Isles ALPHA
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=3][b]None of these resources or parts of them may be used in paid mods[/b][/size][/color]

=========================
Phitt's Morrowind Style Lanterns

Modder's Resource
=========================

By Phitt

Converted and modified by Tamira

=========================

These are Morrowind style lanterns, moving and static, converted from Phitt's Oblivion mod "Sheogorad - Forsaken Isles ALPHA", a remake of the Morrowind region Sheogorad in the North of Vvardenfell

You can find the original file here:
http://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/37329/?

Phitt gave me permission to convert and upload the resources that are included in his great mod.

=========================

During the conversion work on this I found several wonderful Morrowind style lanterns. When I tested them in game I found it annoying that you can bump into them and bounce back or get stuck - by paper lanterns! So I decided to make these paper lanterns movable for more realism.

To make them available for a broader spectrum of modders I separated these modified lanterns - movable and statics - for a standalone upload.
I added two static glass lanterns and some lantern-hangings as well.

=========================

Important:

Add the lanterns in the folder "Lanterns Movable Static" as Movable Statics in the CK.
The lanterns in the folder "Lanterns Static" should be added as Statics.

Known issues with the movable lanterns: The ragdoll physics on these is a little devil. They may not always behave like expected in the game. If you experience weird behavior, try to move them a little bit on their hanging, or try a different lantern model or a different hanging. Don't place them too close to a wall or another object. If nothing else helps to make them behave properly, use the statics instead.

=========================

Have a look at my friend Antiscamp's WIP mod "Azura's Watch" where he used many of these models already and made excellent use of them:

http://frontierskyrim.wordpress.com/
http://frontierskyrim.wordpress.com/2014/10/14/the-third-tribe/

=========================
Tools Used:
=========================

Nifskope
NifUtils by Skyfox

=================
Permissions:
=================

This is a modders resource.You may use the files for your own mods as long as you give credit to the authors and you do not charge money for it.
Please link back to this resource when you use it in your mod.

You may use this resource in Skyrim Special Edition too. All files should work without problems.

Do not upload to other sites.

=================
Credits:
=================

Phitt - Models/Textures

The Niftools team for giving us Nifskope.
Skyfox from the Niftools team for his great tool NifUtils
author: Phitt and Tamira
